intro: Erigeron chrysopsidis subsp. typicus, commonly known as the blueblue fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its delicate blue to purple flower heads, which are typically surrounded by white to pale blue ray florets. The plant has a basal rosette of narrow, gray-green leaves and grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It is part of the Asteraceae family, known for its composite flower heads. The species is often found in areas with well-drained soils and full sun exposure.
